questions.question: What is the band gap value of Cu2(OHPTP) as determined by theoretical calculations?
What synthesis method was used to create Cu2(OHPTP)?
What is the significance of the unique slipped AA stacking in Cu2(OHPTP)'s structure?
questions.answer: It results in an overlap of the aromatic cores while preventing a direct stacking of Cu atoms, contributing to its semiconducting properties.

questions.question: Is the Cu2(OHPTP) MOF thermally stable up to 300 °C?
How does the charge carrier mobility of Cu2(OHPTP) compare to previously reported semiquinone-based 2D c-MOFs?
questions.answer: Cu2(OHPTP) exhibits a higher charge carrier mobility of about 10.0 cm2 V-1 s-1, which is superior to previously reported semiquinone-based 2D c-MOFs.

questions.question: What role does the D2h-symmetric π-extended ligand (OHPTP) play in the properties of Cu2(OHPTP)?
questions.answer: The D2h-symmetric π-extended ligand (OHPTP) contributes to the unique rhombic lattice structure and semiconducting properties of Cu2(OHPTP).

questions.question: Does the Cu2(OHPTP) MOF exhibit a direct or indirect band gap?
What is the BET surface area of Cu2(OHPTP)?
Is the electrical conductivity of Cu2(OHPTP) higher than 0.05 S cm-1?
What is the primary limitation of the charge carrier mobility in Cu2(OHPTP)?
questions.answer: Grain boundary scattering is the primary limitation, which could be dramatically boosted in larger crystals.

questions.question: Was the crystal structure of Cu2(OHPTP) determined using continuous rotation electron diffraction (cRED)?
What is the role of the square-planar CuO4 linkage in the structure of Cu2(OHPTP)?
questions.answer: The square-planar CuO4 linkage connects two OHPTP ligands, forming the rhombic 2D Cu2(OHPTP) network.

questions.question: Does the presence of tightly bound water molecules in Cu2(OHPTP) affect its thermal stability?
What synthesis precursor is used for the preparation of OHPTP?
Is the charge transport in Cu2(OHPTP) dominated by hopping between different single crystals?
What is the effect of temperature on the scattering times and plasma frequency in Cu2(OHPTP) according to THz-TDS experiments?
questions.answer: Scattering times increase with increasing temperature, indicating a thermally activated hopping-type charge transport mechanism, while the plasma frequency and consequently the p-type charge carrier density remain largely unaffected.

questions.question: Does the Cu2(OHPTP) MOF exhibit paramagnetic behavior?
What is the significance of the high-spin state with 16 unpaired electrons per unit cell in the multilayered 2D c-MOF?
questions.answer: It indicates the presence of unpaired spins mainly localized at the Cu and O centers in the linkage, contributing to the semiconducting properties of the MOF.

questions.question: Is the Cu2(OHPTP) MOF considered a metallic conductor?
What is the impact of the unique rhombic topology on the electronic properties of Cu2(OHPTP)?
questions.answer: The unique rhombic topology, along with the slipped AA stacking, contributes to the semiconducting properties and high charge carrier mobility of Cu2(OHPTP).
